data.title: History of Jaguar Cars - British Luxury Defined, To Models, Timelines and Lots More
data.meta_description: Find out the History of Jaguar Cars in this comprehensive guide, from where did they come from, when were models released & more?
data.text:
When we talk about luxury cars with a dash of sportiness, it's hard to overlook the British brand that has become a symbol of opulence, performance, and elegance - Jaguar.

With a lineage that dates back to the 1920s, Jaguar has consistently pushed the boundaries of automotive engineering and design, and this dates back to the Jaguar XK120 as much as it does the new Jaguar I-Pace.

Consequently, we will take you through the fascinating journey of how Jaguar came to define British luxury globally and what it went through in its history to the top.

The Early Years of the Swallow Sidecar Company

The roots of Jaguar can be traced back to 1922, when two motorcycle enthusiasts, William Lyons and William Walmsley, founded the Swallow Sidecar Company in Blackpool, England.

Initially focused on building motorcycle sidecars, the company soon ventured into car body manufacturing.

It was in these formative years that Lyons showed a flair for design and an eye for detail - traits that would define the Jaguar brand in the years to come.

The Birth of the Jaguar as a Car Brand

In 1935, Lyons felt the need to diversify and aim for the higher end of the market. This move culminated in the launch of the SS Jaguar 2.5 Litre Saloon.

This was the first car to bear the Jaguar name.

The Second World War followed shortly after, forcing the company to halt production and contribute to the war effort.

SS Jaguar 2.5 Litre Saloon Dimensions

Statistic Value Top speed 100 MPH 0 - 60 mph 12 Seconds Horsepower 100 HP Torque 120 lb-ft

Post-War Renaissance

After the war, the SS initials were dropped, and the company was renamed Jaguar Cars Ltd.

This era marked the birth of some of the most iconic Jaguar models, such as the XK120, which was the fastest production car at the time of its launch in 1948.

Jaguar XK120 Dimensions

Stat Value Top speed 120 MPH Acceleration (0 - 60 MPH) 7.5 Seconds Engine 3.4 L Jaguar XK inline-6 Horsepower 160 HP Torque 168 lb-ft Weight 2,800 lbs

The E-Type Phenomenon

The 1960s saw Jaguar introducing what would become arguably the most famous car in its history - the E-Type.

With its sleek design and exceptional performance, it was instantly dubbed the most beautiful car ever made by none other than Enzo Ferrari.

The E-Type became a symbol of the '60s and graced the garages of both celebrities and socialites alike.

1960's E Type Dimensions

Stat Value Engine 3.8 Litre inline-6 Power 265 HP Torque 283 lb-ft 0 - 60 mph 6.3 seconds Top speed 150 MPH

The Modern Era and Tata Motors

Fast forward to the 21st century; Jaguar, now under the ownership of Tata Motors, has continued to innovate.

Models like the Jaguar F-Type and the all electric Jaguar I-PACE are testimonies to Jaguar's commitment to performance and sustainability.

Jaguar F Type Dimensions

Stat Value Engine 5.0 Litre V8 Supercharged Horsepower 575 HP Torque 516 lb-ft 0 - 60 mph 3.5 Seconds Top speed 165 MPH

Jaguar I-Pace Dimensions

Statistic Value Top speed 155 MPH Acceleration 0 - 61 MPH 4.50 Seconds Range 470 Km Battery capacity 90 kWh Charging time 40 minutes (10-80%)

Embracing Electrification

In recent years, Jaguar has boldly stepped into the electric vehicle arena with the I-PACE, an SUV that has received numerous awards and recognitions.

It symbolises Jaguarâ€™s commitment to innovation and a sustainable future, all while retaining the luxury and performance the brand is known for.

Chronilogical Order of Jagaur's Cars and Release Dates

Below, you will find a table of the popular Jaguar models and their initial release date, going back in time.

Model Initial Release Date Jaguar 2.5 Litre Saloon 1935 Jaguar 3.5 Litre Saloon 1937 Jaguar XK120 1948 Jaguar Mark V 1948 Jaguar Mark VII 1951 Jaguar XK140 1954 Jaguar XK150 1957 Jaguar Mark VIII 1957 Jaguar Mark IX 1959 Jaguar E-Type 1961 Jaguar Mark X 1961 Jaguar 420G 1966 Jaguar XJ6 Series 1 1968 Jaguar XJ12 1972 Jaguar XJ-S 1975 Jaguar XJ6 Series 3 1986 Jaguar XJ220 1992 Jaguar XK8 / XKR (X100) 1997 Jaguar X-Type 2002 Jaguar XK (X150) 2006 Jaguar XF 2007 Jaguar F-Type 2012 Jaguar XE 2013 Jaguar F-Pace 2015 Jaguar E-Pace 2017 Jaguar I-Pace 2018

Jaguar's History Overall

Jaguar is not just a car; it's a statement, a lifestyle, and a piece of British heritage.

From its humble beginnings as a sidecar manufacturer to becoming a symbol of luxury and performance, Jaguar has always been about pushing boundaries.

As we move into an era of electric and sustainable vehicles, Jaguar is poised to redefine what British luxury means for the modern world, just as it has done throughout its rich and storied history.

There you have it - a glimpse into the illustrious history of a brand that has become synonymous with British luxury and automotive innovation.

If you're considering making a statement with your next vehicle purchase, remember: driving a Jaguar is not just driving any car; it's embracing a legacy. So why not give our sales team a call to arrange your next test drive.
